data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.title: Token Engineering QF Grants Round: Spring 2024

data.description:
Description
Overview
image

Streaming quadratic funding (SQF) supercharges quadratic funding (QF), the public goods funding mechanism popularized in web3 by Gitcoin, into a real-time allocation engine.
In SQF, donations are open-ended streams rather than one-off transfers. Changes to these streams immediately (and gas-efficiently) impact each grantee’s quadratic matching stream. SQF can be thought of as tabulating and distributing a quadratic matching round every second.
By eliminating time discontinuities of the traditional “round,” SQF can help improve grantee and donor user experiences (no more 2-week shillfests), public goods impact (get funds to public goods faster & more consistently), and governance effectiveness (embrace real-time composability & an active allocation mindset).
More product details are available here

Where is this coming from?
SQF is an open-source collaboration between Gitcoin, Superfluid, and Geo Web.
The pilot implementation is a Gitcoin Allo Protocol v2 strategy enabled by Superfluid’s new General Distribution Agreement and continuously funded by the Geo Web’s PCO land market.
The SQF pilot will be launched in late February & run for two months—after which the teams (and hopefully new contributors!) can apply lessons learned to prepare SQF for broader use and to perpetuate the public goods funding flywheel.
All of SQF’s contracts, interfaces, and tooling are open-source.

How can PublicNouns help?
We are requesting a 5 ETH grant to supplement the pilot’s quadratic matching pool (the Geo Web is a small public good project itself) and to help elevate the profile/legitimacy of this experiment.
100% of the funds will be streamed to public good grantees over the course of the pilot according to community QF votes/donations. The pilot grantee list will be small but include a diverse collection of trusted public goods from the industry.
We would welcome grantee nominations from the pNouns community and, of course, help spreading the word about this new public goods funding primitive.

Recipient Address
0xDE798cD9C53F4806B9Cc7dD27aDf7c641540167c (og.geoweb.eth)

Note: This is a Geo Web-owned EOA that we’ll use to immediately bridge to Optimism, wrap to ETHx, and deposit into the SQF Matching Pool.

Amount in ETH
5

Word Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QtX_yHMEfXf4FDEJ9tT1_F5IyuAV7ftyZttTZ79H10o/edit?usp=sharing
data.title: Contribute 5 ETH to the first-ever Streaming Quadratic Funding matching pool

data.text:
The SQF Pilot wrapped up on April 22nd, 2024. The pool is still up and running in "low-power mode" (limited matching funds). As of May 18th, the matching fund allocation is as follows:

- Geo Web Core (0xE9222B...a5EB10) - 2.782600415 ETH
- RadicalxChange (0x3945D7...9C2bD4) - 1.426343859
- Coin Center (0x5bb38A...E8894f) - 0.482478368
- AW House	(0x1626Cc...761a4e) - 0.2143240425
- Wave Pool (0xF04a7d...71e207) - 0.5633874877
- Web3js (0x1C4447...927071) - 0.06731925918

We had very a successful technical run and engaged with lots of parties interested in using SQF and related allocation strategies. We're going to be launching an SQF Cohort Training Program in conjunction with Gitcoin, so new communities can run their own SQF pools & we all learn together (Apps open through May 31: https://forms.gle/Tvgz89Q22Szoe6f2A). We talked about SQF concepts, the pilot, and what's next on the Green Pill Podcast: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=34DWTkGZ44k.
data.title: Pilot Complete & the SQF Training Cohort

data.text: The SQF Pilot was completed and this grant's 5 ETH was fully allocated by April 22nd, 2024. Public Nouns and all the round participants helped make it a huge success!

questions.query: Vision Statement and Impact: Describe the long-term vision of your project and its intended impact on the Optimism and broader Superchain ecosystem, including both qualitative and quantitative benefits
questions.explanation:
Flow State aims to grow the public goods economy through systems and incentives for Commons-based employment and investment. We can do this with a combination of token engineering (advanced streaming allocation mechanisms), legal structuring (ability to distribute future cash flows to a broad coop membership), and public goods culture (impact=profit commitment).

We’re a retro-profit organization, so the Superchain is the natural home for our product focus and digital coop operations—including onchain patronage distributions. We’re focused on bringing our continuous funding model to Superchain networks, DAOs, and projects to support long-term impact building (quantitative improvement via grantee stability, focus, and incentive alignment) and the capital efficiency necessary for public goods to outcompete private alternatives (qualitative improvement through real-time feedback loops and right-time/place allocation).

questions.query: Initial Strategy: Outline a high-level strategy for how you will achieve your intended impact and key goals for the next 3-6 months
questions.explanation:
Since the SQF pilot, we’ve developed v1 of our Grants Stack-like suite of tools for managing and launching Streaming Quadratic Funding rounds. We’ll use these tools to launch 2-3 partner rounds on the Superchain as part of a plan to responsibly scale (the first round is already scoped/agreed to). 
We’ll incorporate feedback, testing, and enhancements before launching these tools broadly with an open-call cohort of Superchain builders/ecosystems in Q4. The cohort will include training sessions, best practice discussions, and peer collaboration to successfully design and launch SQF rounds. We’ll specifically target other Superchain token engineering projects for participation in the cohort as SQF operators and grantees.

We’ve been working with a top web3+coop legal team for the last month to refine our bylaws, articles, and patronage distribution mechanisms. We also expect to launch our cooperative legal structure in the next 2 months and begin growing the membership. We will have active patronage distributions on the Superchain to strategically support SQF rounds by the end of the year.

questions.query: Team Expertise: Provide a brief summary on the team’s background and relevant expertise in token engineering and/or OP
questions.explanation: Streaming quadratic funding started as a feature on/for the [Geo Web](https://geoweb.network) with Graven and Stefano as lead contributors. The Geo Web has developed and explored innovative streaming and partial common ownership (aka Harberger tax) systems for several years. Gary is a long-time recognized leader and community builder in the public goods space including with Zuzalu & Edge City. Xian has contributed to the Geo Web and numerous public goods/open source projects.

questions.query: Existing Work: Provide evidence of any existing work, such as prototypes, research papers, or previous projects. If you have already done work within OP/ Superchain, please include that here too
questions.explanation: https://geoweb.land/governance (Pilot on OP in “low power mode”), https://mirror.xyz/geoweb.eth/54RLkPhmWIcWP4B8QFlYbVY_M-fxaNqjqZF-5pe3WdI,  https://github.com/Geo-Web-Project

questions.query: Returning grantees: If your project has received prior funding from the Token Engineering Grants Program, please describe the impact that funding has had on the project
questions.explanation: We received ~$3k in GG20 in the TEC Round. That represents almost ⅓ of our total funding to date. We’ve been highly capital efficient building an entire admin suite for launching and managing SQF rounds, a new UI for SQF donations, Farcaster Frames for grantees, and engaging with a top legal team to fashion our digital coop.

data.title: 100 Days of SQF

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Development of Web3 Grants tooling, Experiments with innovative funding mechanisms

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We developed and launched streaming quadratic funding. Since the pilot, we've been working on the round operator and grantee tooling necessary for SQF to proliferate. v1 of these tools are complete and we're working with ecosystem partners launching new SQF rounds to scale responsibly before making the tools permissionless. We've spec'ed and plan to develop other streaming funding strategies.

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We're creating new ways to think about and deliver impact funding where and when needed. We think streaming can align incentives better through real-time feedback loops and upgrade the UX of both grantees and funders.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within Web3 grants. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation:
SQF started on the [Geo Web](https://geoweb.network/. We came up with the idea for SQF because of our long-time focus on mechanism design, use of quadratic funding, and innovation with Superfluid streaming tools. 

https://www.gitcoin.co/blog/geo-web-case-study, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=34DWTkGZ44k

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation: All of our code is open source and will continue to be. We'll write and share case studies for SQF and other streaming funding rounds.

questions.query: What is the desired impact you seek to create through your research, (ie what becomes possible for communities as the result of the research you conduct?)
questions.explanation: We aim to make public good contributions of labor AND capital more sustainable through innovative streaming allocation mechanisms and our digital coop legal structure. Streaming makes it easier for public goods builders to find stability and focus on public impact creation. Our digital coop structure and RPGF offer legally compliant ways to broadly and transparently reward members for the labor and capital they invest in the public good.

questions.query: Please describe your past history conducting research of this nature or the relevant skills that will support your work.
questions.explanation: We've researched, designed, and developed several "radical" systems to grow the public goods pie using partial common ownership, quadratic funding, quadratic voting, etc. Examples include [streaming quadratic funding](https://mirror.xyz/geoweb.eth/54RLkPhmWIcWP4B8QFlYbVY_M-fxaNqjqZF-5pe3WdI), [PCOArt](https://www.radicalxchange.org/wiki/pco-art/), and the [Geo Web's land market](https://docs.geoweb.network/concepts/partial-common-ownership). We have deep experience as builders/grantees, round operators, and mechanism designers.

data.name: OpenCivics
data.description:
This OpenCivics Consortium Round seeks to fund critical collaborative protocols, prototypes, and infrastructures that enable civic engagement and interoperable civic utilities for direct governance and stewardship of our communities and commons. We see these collaborative methods and prototypes as critically underfunded force multipliers for multi-agent coordination on key systemic leverage points that create deep social change. 

Ideal applicants will be engaged in developing technology, applied research, and social processes related to collaboration and coordination for collective action. Projects may address the diverse stack of collaborative protocols needed for successful multi-agent coordination such as: identity and attestation, on-chain delegation and roles, decentralized project management, fundraising and allocation, systems-aware strategic alignment processes, measurement and evaluation, and participatory governance and learning. These efforts may be theoretical and research-based or may be applied contexts of collaboration whose successful actualization could lead to protocolization of key activities and collaborative functions.  

For additional definitions and application details, please visit https://go.opencivics.co/wiki

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: We deployed the SQF factory contracts to Arbitrum One, Optimism, & Base. Our Grants Stack-like UI for running SQF rounds with no-code is ready. We're working with partners to define & launch new SQF programs before opening all the tools up for general use.

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation: We participated in GG20 (https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42161/25/114) and several community rounds in GG21 (https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/10/57/38, https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42161/386/10, & https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42161/385/26)

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
A major ingredient missing in the web3 public goods ecosystem is **sustainability.** Octant has recognized this (see: https://x.com/OctantApp/status/1831164316684312607), and staking 100k ETH can solve one side of the funding equation. 

Our novel approach to continuous, dynamic allocation can be the other. 

SQF, SQV, and other streaming allocation strategies can plug into Octant's funding engine to grow the ecosystem and deliver on our mutual public goods funding mission.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Streaming funding offers a foundation to sustain and grow the Octant community. 

Subscriptions are the dominant business model for content creators, educators, and more in web2 because they align incentives to future value creation, provide budget predictability, and limit decision fatigue. We can bring that model to web3 and the Octant ecosystem, but even better—think of SQF like a matching-pool-supercharged Patreon.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
1) Launch the first SQF partner round (est. Oct 2024)
2) Open permissionless use of the SQF platform and run a training cohort open to Octant community members and other public goods ecosystems (pending the partner round)
3) Develop a streaming QV/direct voting strategy to allocate streams (Q4 2024 to Q1 2025)
4) Launch the Flow State coop (est. Jan 1, 2025)

All of these efforts are aligned with Octant's public goods mission. We've said it in other questions, but we think streaming allocation is a big unlock for the Octant ecosystem.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation: Our project lineage started on the Geo Web in 2020. We were early Gitcoin Grantee recipients (GG7) and have been committed public goods builders since. We know the struggle to sustain ourselves without a traditional business model (we want our products to remain true public goods) but have always stayed committed to paying it forward. We were the first community to launch a QF program on Grants Stack (https://www.gitcoin.co/blog/geo-web-case-study). We have been developing and innovating with Superfluid streams for several years as well. These experiences and expertise culminated in spearheading the collaboration that launched SQF (https://mirror.xyz/geoweb.eth/54RLkPhmWIcWP4B8QFlYbVY_M-fxaNqjqZF-5pe3WdI).

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation:
We've already had multiple conversations with the Octant product team openly sharing our streaming funding knowledge, tools, and plans. We wholeheartedly believe in positive-sum collaboration and act like it. 

Our focus on continuous, dynamic allocation perfectly complements Octant's focus on generating sustainable public goods funding.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation:
The streaming version of QF has several advantages over the traditional periodic model when it comes to community building:
- funding decisions are relational (ongoing streams), not transactional 
- matching is allocated/earned incrementally (less susceptible to low conviction donations & airdrop hunting skew)
We're embracing these advantages in our product and coop organization design. We can embrace mutually beneficial relationships between grantees & funders rather than fearing "quid pro quo."

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: We will use all funding to pay core contributor stipends as we continue to develop our streaming funding platform and collaborate within the Octant ecosystem.  We haven't had the funding to consistently pay contributors, so we don't need to get fancy.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation: We haven't created any educational content specifically for the Octant ecosystem. All our code & tools are open-source and available as resources for the Octant ecosystem.

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/flow-state-coop

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/projects/0x6e16ed35e9c46115e7fb5ba2bbe83f7d35f330b16af66410e7025951ae9a7b82 , https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/projects/0x79bc78382f5adf12f5f9826d1428d3ab10dd4343957f2fb40eda6d81ada95a94

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We’re building and evangelizing new public goods streaming funding mechanisms. We believe streaming funding creates donor/grantee incentive alignment and promotes sustainability. Our first partner round will allocate at least 15 ETH to deserving public goods builders.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: We’re a pioneer in streaming funding allocation strategies. Streaming Quadratic Funding uses the familiar QF matching formula but creates a totally different funding dynamic. We’ve built a no-code UI for operators to launch, fund, and manage SQF rounds. This doesn’t exist anywhere else.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We’re bootstrapped and still far below taking home “full-time” pay for our efforts. All the funding will be used to sustain our core team and cover incidental costs. We will be laser-focused on launching more SQF and streaming funding rounds for the rest of the year. We have line-of-sight on ~$400k GMV by year-end.

questions.query: How does your project focus on building on, integrating with, or supporting the Allo Protocol ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of your work and plans.
questions.explanation: Our flagship mechanism, streaming quadratic funding, is built as an Allo v2 strategy: https://github.com/flow-state-coop/allo-v2/tree/main/contracts/strategies/_poc/sqf-superfluid.

questions.query: Describe your project's current status and roadmap. Are you actively developing on Allo Protocol, or do you have a clear plan for future integration?
questions.explanation: We’ve already built one production strategy (SQF). We are evaluating additional strategies. We provided feedback to the protocol team about challenges with streams & Allo 2.0 (i.e. feedback for v2.1).

questions.query: Outline your plans for community engagement and user adoption. How will you contribute to expanding the Allo ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Our first external partner round launches on October 24th. Our North Star is making those (and all future) public goods grantees sustainable. During rounds, we’ll be honing our playbooks and actively supporting grantees to prove the model works. Our demonstrated success with high-quality grantees will help us attract more grant program sponsors. We’re actively developing relationships and plans with several of these groups.

questions.query: How do you envision your project driving GMV (Gross Merchandise Value) through the Allo protocol? Please provide potential metrics or estimates.
questions.explanation: Streaming quadratic funding GMV is Allo GMV. We have ~$95k in committed capital to allocate through SQF before year-end. We have a line-of-site on ~$400k+ more.

questions.query: Provide your Karma GAP profile link and briefly describe how you'll use it for milestone tracking.
questions.explanation:
- https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/flow-state-streaming-quadratic-funding 
- We’ll post major milestones on Karma GAP like new funding rounds, new features, and GMV milestones. We’ll be engaging with and providing real-time updates to our steaming funding supporters on Flow State as well.

questions.query: If applicable, list any contract addresses or other verifiable on-chain objects related to your project that demonstrate your work with Allo. Use this format for each entry: [contract_address], [chain_id]
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We’re building and evangelizing new public goods streaming funding mechanisms. We believe streaming funding creates donor/grantee incentive alignment and promotes sustainability. Our first partner SQF round has streamed over 25.5 ETH to OSS/public goods builders. More funding rounds and mechanisms are on the way.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
We’re a pioneer in streaming* funding allocation strategies. Streaming Quadratic Funding uses the familiar QF matching formula but creates a totally different funding dynamic. We’ve built a [no-code UI for operators to launch, fund, and manage SQF rounds](https://flowstate.network/admin). This doesn’t exist anywhere else. Flow Splitters (teams/guilds) and Flow Councils (direct voting) are our emerging apps bringing streaming capabilities to new contexts.

*Superfluid's streaming model is "token-centric" and allows for gasless, real-time settlement. Other streaming solutions are more akin to "streaming accounting" because a withdrawal transaction is required to access funds. We think the Superfluid model will allow more composability, capital efficiency, and programmability.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
We’re bootstrapped and taking less than “full-time” pay for our efforts. All the funding will be used to sustain our core team and cover incidental costs. Our roadmap includes:
- Launching more SQF rounds with partners
- Developing a no-code launcher for Flow Councils
- Adding an API and other tools for dynamic unit management of Flow Splitters
